abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Electricity Market Project for Romania is to develop a
            well-functioning wholesale electricity market with the aim
            of: (a) putting in place a transparent and predictable
            commercial and regulatory framework and a power exchange
            that will facilitate electricity trading within a
            competitive national, regional and eventually European
            market; and (b) improving the efficiency and reliability of
            the transmission system in order to support trading and
            supply electricity at least cost to consumers. A
            well-functioning wholesale electricity market is an integral
            component of Romania's strategy to attract and sustain
            private sector participation in power sector renewal,
            especially for the refurbishment o f power distribution and
            generation assets, and to develop a more efficient and
            increasingly competitive power sector. There are two main
            project components. The project will be implemented by
            Transelectrica (Romania's grid company and power system
            operator), OPCOM ("Operator Commercial," the
            subsidiary of the national power company and Romania's
            power market operator),  and ANRE (the regulatory agency for
            electricity and heat). The first component, the investment
            component, rehabilitates the Iernut substation and Fundeni
            Substation, and finances engineering and supervision
            consulting services. The second component , the technical
            assistance component, 1) designs and implements the
            regulatory framework (commercial code, market rules, and
            price-caps for network services) for the new Electricity
            Trading Platform; 2) designs, pilot tests, and implements
            the new Electricity Trading Platform through the OPCOM Power
            Exchange; and 3) provides institutional support to Transelectrica.
